Uses of Graph in gr.forth.ics.graph
 

Classes in gr.forth.ics.graph that implement Graph
 class FoldingGraph
           
 class GraphForwarder
           
 class PrimaryGraph
          Fastest Graph implementation, which has the restriction that its nodes and edges cannot be contained in any other PrimaryGraph (but they can be contained in as many SecondaryGraphs as desirable).
 class SecondaryGraph
          Flexible Graph implementation, which can contain (adopt) nodes and edges from any other graph.

          Returns the value of the given key as Graph.

          Deprecated. Use PrimaryGraph.PrimaryGraph() instead.
static Graph GraphFactory.newGraph(Hint... hints)
          Deprecated. Use PrimaryGraph.PrimaryGraph() and InspectableGraph.hint(Hint) instead.

Uses of Graph in gr.forth.ics.graph.algo.transitivity
 

Methods in gr.forth.ics.graph.algo.transitivity with parameters of type Graph
static void Transitivity.acyclicReduction(Graph g, PathFinder pathFinder)
          Creates the transitive reduction of a directed acyclic graph, using a pathFinder object to check whether two arbitrary nodes of the specified graph are connected via some path.
static void Transitivity.materialize(Graph g, Closure closure)
          Translates a specified transitive closure to edges in a graph, that is, after this method every node of the graph has at least one edge to each node belonging to each successor set, as defined by the given closure.
